title: How to Remove the Drain Plug in a Car to Change Oil

steps.title: Prepare.
steps.content: Prepare. Get oil and a filter replacement.

steps.title: Gather more materials.
steps.content: Gather more materials. Get together a jack, a socket set and oil. Park on a flat surface, or, if your car has a low clearance, use jack slopes or set it up. If you choose to support the car, use two jacks, rather than a slope. [1] X Research source (An additional jack costs about US $ 20, this is a very small price and guarantees you'll avoid a serious over-balance and a car crushing your face).

steps.title: Let your car engine run for 10 minutes.
steps.content: Let your car engine run for 10 minutes. This will oil the drain plug more easily. You might want to check the weight of your car's oil and oil-filter manually you need to use. [2] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Drain and replace the oil filter.
steps.content: Drain and replace the oil filter. Crawl under, and find the engine oil screw near the front. Where you plug in the socket, use the wrench to loosen the plug in a counterclockwise direction. Once relaxed, you can use your hand and remove the plug. The hot oil will begin to pour out. Ensure that all the old oil goes into the pan. Once it is completely discharged, wipe the screw and plug opening. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Now replace the drain plug gasket and reinstall the plugin using the wrench, but don't make it too tight.
steps.content: Now replace the drain plug gasket and reinstall the plugin using the wrench, but don't make it too tight.

steps.title: Next, find the oil filter.
steps.content: Next, find the oil filter. They are usually found in the side of the engine. Filter off any of the oil sump. Remove the oil filter (use gloves if it is too hot) and wipe clean the filter area, especially when it is installed in the engine. [4] X Research source Dab rubber seal on your new oil filter, and then twist it with your hands. You don't have to use the wrench to tighten the oil filter. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Add the new oil.
steps.content: Add the new oil. Remove the filler cap above the engine of the car. Position the funnel at the opening point. Check the correct oil capacity in your car's manual, but typically, you will need to pour four to five quarts of oil. After it's full, put back to the filler cap. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Start the engine and let it run a minute.
steps.content: Start the engine and let it run a minute. Check the dipstick. If you need, add more oil. [7] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source Now check near the oil drain and plug any leaks. If you find leaks, simply screw in the plugs or the oil filter. You're done.

steps.title: Clean up.
steps.content: Clean up. Carefully wipe excess oil, old oil into a plastic container, and then deal with it. Don't just pour in any place, however. It is better to bring it to a recycling center or other authorized locations.
